title: Pip Edwards treats Ksubi guests to a platter of cigarettes at an event
description: Pip Edwards made quite the statement at an exclusive Ksubi event in Sydney this week - and it wasn't just her outfit doing the talking.
content:
Pip Edwards made a bold statement at an exclusive Ksubi event in Sydney on Thursday night.

The fashion designer, 44, treated party guests to a platter of cigarettes and endless booze during the glitzy launch of her new capsule collection with UK influencer Alicia Roddy.

Pip, who is known for her bold sense of style, shared a photo dump from the night to Instagram, showing her mingling with the socialite set and letting her hair down in true party-girl fashion.

In one photo, a chic tray stacked with cigarettes and matches was seen being offered at Paddington eatery 10 William St – a decadent nod to old-school party glamour.

'It’s been a whirlwind, crazy busy few days … but we are soooooo excited that our @ksubi x @lissyroddyy capsule has finally arrived... with the Queen herself in town!!! We love you Lissy!!!!!' Pip wrote alongside the photos.

The P.E Nation founder turned heads at the event in a white Ksubi crop top paired with an unbuttoned pinstriped jacket and matching wide-leg pants.

Pip wore her blonde hair tied in a bun and accessorised with statement jewellery.

She was all smiles as she posed with fashion insiders and influencers, including Ksubi fashion collaborator Alicia Roddy, cricket WAG Erin Holland and influencer Elle Ferguson.

But while the fashion set turned out in full force, there was one notable absence - Pip's best friend Jackie 'O' Henderson was nowhere to be seen.

The 50-year-old radio queen was missing from the stylish soirée despite the pair being virtually inseparable in recent months.

Pip and Jackie have been close friends for years.

The fashion designer shared a sweet tribute to her bestie in January as the radio queen marked her 50th birthday milestone.

Pip took to Instagram to share two photos commemorating her friendship with the KIIS FM star.

The first image showed the pair huddling close as they happily enjoyed a drink.

The pair looked to be having a great time at what appeared to be Bondi hotspot Icebergs.

Captioning the sweet photo, Pip gave her close friend some high praise.

'Wishing this Wonder Woman a very happy birthday,' Pip wrote. '50 has never looked so good!'

'A true inspiration, the best supportive friend, and someone I love exploring and living life with! Happy birthday @jackieo_official.'

Pip followed up the sweet post with a second celebratory image showing the pair together.

Captioning the photo, Pip offered another round of best wishes with: 'happy birthday Jackie.'
summary: Fashion designer Pip Edwards attended an exclusive Ksubi event in Sydney on Thursday night, where she served a platter of cigarettes and alcohol for guests. The event was part of the launch of her capsule collection with UK influencer Alicia Roddy. Despite being a significant milestone for Pip, she was noticeably absent from the event. She shared a photo dump of the night on Instagram, showing her mingling with socialite set and enjoying a drink at Paddington eatery 10 William St.
shortSummary: Pip Edwards celebrated her 44th birthday with a lavish dinner at Ksubi, featuring cigarettes, alcohol, and a tribute to her best friend Jackie 'O' Henderson.

The activewear entrepreneur, 44, tells Stellar Magazine that Jackie's honest inspires her.
'I think for her it was extremely healing and it was time for her to stand in her truth. It's nothing to be ashamed of. And to all the critics out there, f*ck off. Sorry' Pip said.
'The night Jackie released the story on radio, I went to her house to be with her and give her a big hug'.
The The P.E Nation founder says that the women are 'spiritually aligned' and share an incredibly close friendship.
Pip Edwards (pictured) has shared how she stood by the side of her good friend Jackie 'O' Henderson amidst revelations that she battled drug addiction
'Jackie O is one of the most humble, interested, invested females I've ever met. Who she is and how she speaks, she's that on the street' she said.
'We're spiritually aligned, emotionally connected. It's honest. I think that really shines through in how we interact, even if it's on Instagram. I just will forever have her back.'
Jackie revealed how she plans to celebrate her two years of sobriety as she marks the milestone just weeks after detailing her addiction publicly.
She told how she spent 28 days in the famous rehab clinic, The Betty Ford Center, in November 2022 after struggling with addiction during the Covid lockdown.
In a candid extract, Jackie revealed that at the height of her addiction, she took around 10-12 Stilnox/Ambien sleeping pills and 24 Panadeine Forte painkillers a day.
After overcoming her addiction struggles, Jackie has now told how she is marking her two years of sobriety on Thursday, November 14, in a milestone achievement.
Speaking to Daily Mail Australia at Marie Claire's Women of the Year Awards on Wednesday, Jackie revealed how she spends to mark the occasion with her friends.
'I think we will go out for dinner and celebrate, for sure,' Jackie proudly shared.

A horrified Jackie then said that Pip made it sound like 'we are coming out' and Kyle joked they were 'like a lesbian couple'.
Pip added they had such a great platonic friendship and one of the things she most admired about Jackie was how kind she was to everyone they came across.
Kyle asked if Jackie had the same sweet personality off the air that she did when presenting alongside him.
'When I see her being inundated with fans, she is so lovely and gives everyone her time. She really does give it back and it is really beautiful to watch,' Pip confirmed.

The friends, who were recently hit by rumours of a rift, co-founded athleisure brand in Sydney back in 2015, and since turned it into a globally thriving business.
However Claire stepped back from running the label, while Pip has continued at the helm of the brand solo.

Sydney
Sydney - one of the largest cities in Australia - is the capital of the state of New South Wales. It is also the oldest city in the country, with the first settlers arriving in 1788. Major sites of interest include the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Sydney Opera House and the world-famous Bondi Beach. Celebrity Sydneysiders include actors Hugh Jackman, Russell Crowe and Nicole Kidman as well as rock band AC/DC.

argos_summary: Pip Edwards publicly supported her close friend Jackie 'O' Henderson as she revealed her struggles with drug and alcohol addiction in her memoir. Edwards praised Henderson's honesty and emphasized their spiritually aligned friendship, stating that she would always have her back. Henderson, who celebrated two years of sobriety, shared her journey of recovery, including a stint at the Betty Ford Center.
